description:
If you run tox -r -e releasenotes once with errors, fix the errors, and then run it again, you'll get the same failures.

This is because nova/releasenotes/build is not cleaned up in tox.ini per run, regardless of the tox -r option.
title: tox -r -e releasenotes does not rebuild

comments.content:
If you run tox -r -e releasenotes once with errors, fix the errors, and then run it again, you'll get the same failures.

This is because nova/releasenotes/build is not cleaned up in tox.ini per run, regardless of the tox -r option.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/268280
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/268280
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=ce8030f2517971d34fcad38bd9fe366faf9697df
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit ce8030f2517971d34fcad38bd9fe366faf9697df
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Jan 18 12:42:27 2016 -0800

    Remove releasenotes/build between releasenotes runs
    
    Just like in the docs target, we should remove the releasenotes/build
    directory between runs of the releasenotes target to avoid stale
    sphinx results corrupting the current run results.
    
    Change-Id: Ia9e0409344671e04148308e08c26e8796227f0f7
    Closes-Bug: #1534640
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 13.0.0.0b3 development milestone.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~doug-hellmann
